text: Kalynn Park (born September 12, 1988) is a Canadian curler and curling coach. She is right-handed. She and Charley Thomas won the 2015 Canadian Mixed Doubles Curling Trials and represented Canada at the 2015 World Mixed Doubles Curling Championship. ==Achievements== * Canadian Mixed Doubles Curling Championship: gold (2015), silver (2014). * Canadian Junior Curling Championships: bronze (2009). ==Teams and events== ===Women's=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col"| Place |- | 2015–16 || 2016 World Mixed Doubles Curling Championship || (mixed doubles) ||23 |} ==Personal life== Park is a graduate of the University of Alberta and Athabasca University. She works as a Paralegal for Law Fifty One.Kalynn Park - Law Fifty One: Personal Injury Lawyers She is the daughter of curler Kevin Park and was married to Brock Virtue.Edmonton Journal, January 24 2017, "Alberta Scotties Odds" ==References== ==External links== * *Curling World Cup profile *Linkedin profile * * Category:1988 births Category:Living people Category:Canadian women curlers Category:Canadian mixed doubles curling champions Category:Curlers from Alberta Category:Sportspeople from Calgary Category:Sportspeople from Edmonton Category:Canadian curling coaches Category:University of Alberta alumni Category:Athabasca University alumni
